You have two options for creating private courses: starting fresh or converting an existing course. So, let‚Äôs begin by setting up a new course with private access from the start.

  • Navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Courses.
  • Click¬†Add New Course.
  • Fill in your course details (name, description, highlights, etc.)

For a detailed guide, check out the¬†guide on creating a complete course.

  • Click the dropdown arrow next to the¬†Publish¬†button.
  • Select¬†Switch To Private¬†from the options.

That‚Äôs it. Now, you can navigate to¬†Course Builder¬†to configure the course with¬†lessons,¬†quizzes, and so on.

If you navigate back to the¬†Courses¬†list, you can view the private course.

lessons.post_content:
1. First,¬†enable Zapier addon.
  2. Log in to Zapier to create a new Zap
  3. Click on the trigger.
  4. Search for¬†Masteriyo¬†and select the app.
  5. For¬†Trigger event, click on the drop-down menu and select an event.
  6. Under¬†Account, click on¬†Sign In.
  7. Now, you'll get a new interface asking for your site URL and the API key.
  8. Go back to your WordPress website, and navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Zapier. Here, you'll see the API key.
  9. Copy and paste the key and hit¬†Yes, Continue to Masteriyo.
  10. Click on the¬†Continue¬†button to proceed further. It'll now provide you with the option to test the trigger to confirm your trigger. Test to confirm the trigger. If you see any records, it confirms that the trigger has been set.Once you see the record, you can click on¬†Continue with selected record.

For further refrence check masteriyo docs.
lessons.post_title: Using Masteriyo Trigger Webhooks with Zapier

lessons.post_content:
Action webhooks allow external applications to perform actions within your Masteriyo LMS. This feature is available in the PRO version and enables you to integrate Masteriyo with CRM systems, automation tools, or other applications.

Supported Action Webhooks

Masteriyo supports the following action webhooks:

Action Webhook Description Required Parameters
masteriyo_user_enrolled_to_course Enrolls a user in a specific course user_id¬†(number),¬†course_id¬†(number)
masteriyo_create_student Creates a new student account email,¬†user_name,¬†firstname,¬†lastname
masteriyo_create_instructor Creates a new instructor account email,¬†user_name,¬†firstname,¬†lastname
masteriyo_complete_lesson Marks a lesson as complete for a user lesson_id,¬†user_id,¬†course_id
masteriyo_course_progress_reset Resets course progress for a user course_id,¬†user_id
masteriyo_unenrolled_user_from_coursey Unenrolls a user from a course course_id,¬†user_id
masteriyo_course_user_completed EMarks a course as completed for a user user_id,¬†course_id

Setting Up Action Webhooks

To send action webhooks to Masteriyo from an external application (such as Zapier), use the following configuration:
Endpoint URL

https://your-site.com/wp-json/masteriyo/v1/webhooks/action

Method

Use the¬†POST¬†method for all action webhooks.

Headers

Include the following header for authentication:

X-WP-Webhook-Token: [your-webhook-token]

The webhook token can be generated and found in the Masteriyo Webhooks settings.

Payload Format

Use JSON format. For example,

{
  "event": "masteriyo_course_user_completed",
  "user_id": 123,
  "course_id": 456
}

The¬†event¬†parameter specifies which action to trigger, and additional parameters will vary based on the selected action.
lessons.post_title: Action Webhooks (Incoming Data) Pro

lessons.post_content:
Trigger webhooks send data from your Masteriyo LMS to external applications whenever specific events occur on your site.

Setting Up Trigger Webhooks

  1. Navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Webhoooks¬†in your WordPress admin dashboard.
  2. Click¬†Add New Webhook.
    image refrence
  3. Configure the webhook with the following settings:

    • Webhook Name¬†- Provide a name for the Webhook.
    • Description¬†- Describe the purpose of the Webhook.
    • Status(Active)¬†- Enable this to make the Webhook active.
    • Delivery URL¬†- Enter the URL where you want to send the data.
    • Events - Lets you select the desired event for sending the data. There are various events available. Image refrence

Note: The Event will vary for the admin and the instructors.

Secret(Optional)¬†- This helps you identify if a malicious third-party system has altered the data before it reaches its destination.

After filling in all the required information, click on¬†Create¬†to save the webhook.

Available Trigger Events

Masteriyo offers various events that can trigger webhooks:

  • Course Completed

  • Course Published

  • Course Question Created

  • Course Question Reply Created

  • Course Review Created

  • Instructor Registration

  • Lesson Completed

  • Lesson Published

  • Quiz Completed

  • Quiz Published

  • Student Enrolled

  • Student Registration

    Note: When logged in as an instructor, webhooks will only be triggered for events related to that specific instructor's courses and activities.

Trigger Webhook Payload Format

Masteriyo sends data to your specified URL using HTTP POST in JSON format when a trigger event occurs.
lessons.post_title: Trigger Webhooks (Outgoing Data)

lessons.post_content:
Webhooks¬†are a powerful feature in Masteriyo that enables real-time communication between your WordPress LMS and external applications. This documentation covers both types of webhook functionality available in Masteriyo:

Trigger Webhooks (Outgoing): Send data from Masteriyo to external applications when specific events occur in your LMS.

Action Webhooks (Incoming): Allow external applications to trigger actions within Masteriyo.

What are Webhooks?

Webhooks allow different applications to communicate automatically with each other in real-time. When an event occurs in one application, it can notify another through webhooks, triggering specific actions or transferring data without manual intervention.

Step-by-Step Activation Process of Masteriyo LMS Addons

  1. Log in to your WordPress¬†Dashboard.
  2. Go to¬†Masteriyo¬†>Add-ons.
  3. Click on the toggle button to activate your desired add-ons.
  4. Once you have set up the Gradebook add-on on your site, you can now create Grades for the courses you make. For this, navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Gradebook.

    Here, you will find two tabs.

    • Results
    • Grade Builder

Grade Builder

In order to assign grades to the score of the students, you will need to create grading at first. For this, navigate to¬†Gradebook > Grade Builder.

As shown on the above image, you can find two options on this page as well. You can either create your own grades or import demo grade created by us for your ease.

To import the demo, just click on¬†Import Demo Data.

After you click on this option, a few grades will be imported for you. You can edit these grades as per your need.

However, you will have the option to create your own grade from the get go. Just click on the¬†Add New Grade.

Once you click on this option, a new grade will be added.

You can click on the¬†Edit¬†button to edit the grade as per your need.

  • Name: Provide a name for the grade that you are creating. For example, Excellent, A+, etc.
  • Points: Set points assigned to the user with this grade.
  • Color: Select a color for the grade.
  • Range: Set a range of the percentage to assign to the grade. For example, grade X for 0 to 30%, etc.

Results

You can set the grades you have created to assignments and courses. Once the users attempt the quiz or completes assignment, they will be graded as per the points, percentage. You can view these results in the Results tab. Note that the assignments require review. Therefore, they must be reviewed in order to appear on the Results tab. Same goes for the quizzes that require review. First of all, you will need to set weight for quiz and assignment to provide grading for the users.

How to assign course and assignment weight?

In order to grade any user based on their quiz attempt and assignment, you will need to set weight for the quiz and assignment, respectively. This can be done from the individual quiz/assignment settings.

Navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Courses > Select Course > Builder > Select Quiz/Assignment > Settings.

Here, you will find the option to set Quiz/Assignment weight in the General tab.

Location¬†Masteriyo ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Advanced ‚Üí Tracking ‚Üí Track Student Activity

The Track Student Activity feature in the Masteriyo LMS plugin helps monitor student engagement by tracking important details like how long students spend in lessons, their quiz attempts, and assignment submissions. It collects this data to help educators better understand student performance and improve learning results. image

The¬†Track Student Activity¬†option includes two key settings to ensure accurate monitoring and reporting of user activity:

  • Server Sync Interval Duration¬†- This setting controls how often the system updates user activity data to the server. The time is measured in minutes, and the default is 5 minutes. For example, if it is set to 5 minutes, the LMS will send updated activity data to the server every 5 minutes. This helps with near real-time tracking and reduces the chances of data loss.

  • Idle Time Threshold¬†- This setting decides how long a student can be inactive before their session is marked as idle. The default time is 30 minutes. If the student doesn't click or do anything for 30 minutes, their session will be marked idle. This helps teachers know if the student is active or just logged in.

These options ensure accurate activity tracking and provide valuable insights into student engagement.

Where can I find the student activity reports?

Masteriyo provides individual course reports. To access a report for each course, including student activity and progress, go to your Dashboard > Masteriyo > Courses. Click the three dots next to a course, then select the "Reports" button. This will show advanced analytics for that course, including the student status. You can click on any student in the list to view their activity report. image

Please note that the "Time Spent" information will update based on the Server Sync Interval Duration setting.

A feature that allows teachers to share engaging activities and content with their class directly within Google Classroom.

Setup and Configuration

  • Activate the¬†Google Classroom Integration add-on

Once you have activated the add-on, go to¬†Masteriyo > Google Classroom > Settings. You will see the following options.

How to generate Google Client ID and Secret?

  • Go to¬†Google Cloud Console
  • Go to the Project dropdown and click on¬†New Project.

  • Provide the project's name and click on¬†Create.
  • Go to the OAuth Consent Screen. Choose¬†External¬†in the¬†User Type¬†and click on¬†Create.

  • Provide the app's name, save and continue until you go to the last step. In the last step, click on 'Back to Dashboard'.
  • In the OAuth Consent Screen dashboard, you will see¬†Publishing Status. Click on the¬†PUBLISH APP.

  • Go to Enable API & Services and search for the Google Classroom API.

  • Enable this API and go back to the main dashboard.

  • Go to¬†Credentials > Create Credentials >OAuth Client ID.

  • In the Application Type, choose Web application. Give the name for the application.
  • In the¬†Authorized redirect URIs, you will need to add the redirect URL given in the Masteriyo > Google Classroom > Settings.

  • Click on¬†Create.

You will then get the Client ID and Secret. Copy this to a clipboard for further process.

Connect Google Account to Masteriyo

Once you have created the Client ID and Secret, go to¬†Masteriyo > Google Classroom > Settings. Add the copied credentials to the required options. Then, click on the Save button to get the following screen.

Now, click on¬†Connect Google Account. Now, all the Google Classrooms you have created will be shown on the¬†Google Courses.

In the¬†Action¬†tab, you need to click on Import to merge these classrooms to the Masteriyo courses. After you import, you will be able to publish the class. Once published, you can check other actions.

You can update course, import students, preview the course or delete it completely.

Other Settings

  • Code For Logged in Users Only¬†- When enabled, this option restricts the access to the classroom invite codes. For free classrooms, only logged-in users can see the code.
  • Clear Course Cache¬†- Deletes the existing caches data and requests for new course data from Google Classroom.
  • Clear All Data¬†- Deletes the all the data, so users have to sign in again to synch the data to Google Classroom

Our Zoom integration simplifies the virtual classroom experience by allowing instructors to schedule and launch meetings directly from the platform. Students can access the virtual classroom, participate in live sessions, and interact with their peers and instructors in real-time, all within the Masteriyo plugin.

Before you begin:

  1. Get¬†Masteriyo LMS Pro plan or higher.
  2. Activate and¬†install Masteriyo LMS.
  3. Activate the¬†Zoom Integration add-on.

Getting credentials from the Zoom

  • Go to¬†Zoom's developer site

  • Click on 'Develop' on the top-right.

  • Now, navigate to Develop > Build app

  • Find¬†Server-to-server OAuth¬†and click on¬†Create.

  • Provide the app-name

Now, you will be able to find the necessary credentials to integrate the Zoom with the Masteriyo. Copy these details in a clipboard.

After getting the credentials, you will have to provide access to the Zoom app for the integration. Simply, click¬†Continue¬†to move forward. Now, provide necessary information like Company Name, developer's name, and email,l and click¬†Continue.

Now, move to the¬†Scope¬†section and click on¬†Add Scope. Here, you will have to add the required scopes related to the Meeting, Webinar, and Recording.

Scopes Example:meeting:write:meeting, meeting:write:meeting:admin, meeting:update:meeting:admin, meeting:update:meeting We have added all the scopes under Meeting, Webinar, and Recording.

¬†

Find the list of required scopes¬†here

Click on¬†Continue¬†and then click on¬†Activate your app.

You wil have to set the time zone from your Profile on the Zoom to make this integration work. For this, log in to your account and go to your profile. You will find an option called¬†Time Zone. Click on the Edit button and set your time zone and save the changes.

Now the Zoom app is ready to be integrated with the Masteriyo and host meetings as per your need.

Integrating Credentials to Masteriyo

Once you have created and activated the Zoom App, you will have to add the given Account ID, Client ID and Client Secret to the Masteriyo plugin to host Zoom Meetings. For this, navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Zoom > Setting¬†and add the required credentials.

Now, click on¬†Update.

Adding Zoom Meeting on a Course

After the setup is completed, you can add Zoom Meetings on the courses you have created. For this, go to the¬†Course Builder, on the¬†Builder¬†tab, you need to add a new section. Name the section as you want and click on¬†Add.

Now, add a new content and select¬†Add new Zoom Meeting.

After this, you will see a meeting builder where you will have to enter the meeting's title, starting date and time and duration at first.

You can now¬†Publish¬†the meeting.

Please note that there are various other option that you can set in the meeting builder area. These options are as described below.

  • Join Before Host¬†- Enable this to allow the meeting attendee to attend the meeting before the host joins.
  • Participant Video¬†- Enable this to allow attendees to engage and contribute during the meeting.
  • Focus Mode¬†- Enable this to allow attendee to conceal additional notifications and eliminate distractions.
  • Mute Upon Entry¬†- Enable this to mute the attendee when they join the meeting.
  • Close Registration¬†- Enable this to prevent registrations after the event date/meeting date.
  • Recording Storage¬†- You can either store the recorded meeting on your local storage or use cloud service.
  • Meeting Password¬†- Set a password, if required, for your meeting.

Masteriyo provides individual course reports. To access a report for each course, including student activity and progress, go to your¬†Dashboard > Masteriyo > Courses. Click the three dots next to a course, then select the¬†"Reports"¬†button.

This will show advanced analytics for that course, including sales, enrollment, and student progress.

Student's Progress

To check the progress of the enrolled students, scroll to the Enrolled Students section. Here, you will find the list of the students enrolled in the respective course. You can click the¬†Progress¬†button for each student to check and modify their progress.

Mark as Complete¬†

Administrators can override user progress statuses through two methods:

  • Mark All As Complete:¬†Mark an entire course as completed for specific users.
  • Mark as Complete:¬†Manually mark individual course components (lessons, quizzes, assignments, etc.) as completed.
    This feature is ideal for correcting progress tracking errors or accommodating exceptional circumstances.

Reset Progress¬†

This functionality enables administrators to:

  • Reset user progress for entire courses through the Reset Progress button. It removes all completion records, quiz attempts, and tracked metrics associated with the selected course.

Note:¬†This action is irreversible. Users will need to restart progress from the beginning.

lessons.post_content:
Drip Content is a powerful feature that allows you to release course materials to your learners over a set period of time. By integrating Drip Content into your LMS plugin, you can easily schedule the release of content and assessments, providing a more structured and organized learning experience for your students. This documentation will guide you through the process of integrating Drip Content into your LMS plugin.

Prerequisite:

  1. Masteriyo LMS Pro plan or higher.
  2. Active¬†installation of Masteriyo LMS.
  3. Enable the¬†Content Drip Add-on.
¬†

Note:¬†Free and Sequential features are available in the Masteriyo free plan, while the Date Selection and X Days from Enrollment features are available in the Masteriyo Pro plan or higher.

Setup and Configuration

Once you¬†activate the plugin¬†and enable the add-on, follow the steps below.

  1. Go to Courses and select the desired course.
  2. Select the desired course and click on¬†Edit.
  3. Go to¬†Settings¬†>¬†Content Drip.
  4. Select the desired Content Drip option for your¬†lesson/quiz.
  5. You can select any one out of the four available options from the¬†Content Drip settings.

These options determine the flow of the lessons/quizzes in your courses. The available options are described in detail below.

Free:

Choosing this option means that the flow of the content is random. The users can jump from the first lesson/quiz, let‚Äôs say the last, without completing the courses in the middle.

Sequential:

Unlike the Free option, this option sets a sequential rule for your lesson/quiz. Now the users will have to complete the first lesson/quiz to move forward to the next lesson/quiz.

The locked lessons/quizzes will appear as:

Date Selection:

You can choose this option to unlock the lessons/quizzes on a particular date and onwards.

  1. The data can be set from¬†Builder¬†>¬†Lesson/Quiz.
  2. Click¬†on the edit icon for the desired lesson/quiz.
  3. Select the desired date at the Drip Date option, and the lesson will only be unlocked on that particular date and onwards.

The locked lesson will be shown as:

X Days from Enrollment:

This option lets you choose to unlock the lessons/quiz after a number of days from enrollment.

  1. The days are also set at¬†Builder¬†>¬†Lesson/Quiz.
  2. Click¬†on the edit icon for the desired lesson/quiz.
  3. Enter the number of days on the Drip Days option, and the lesson will be unlocked after that many days of enrollment.

The locked lessons/quizzes will be shown below:

lessons.post_content:
• Masteriyo Documentation
  • Free Add-Ons
  • Groups

Groups add-on enables the allocation of courses to a collective audience and facilitates the commercial sale of these educational programs to organizations. For example, a student can buy a course for a group of 3 and share the course with their two other friends.

Prerequisites:

  • Masteriyo LMS Free or higher.
  • Groups add-on

Adding Groups to a Course

To add a new group, go to the¬†Settings¬†of your course:¬†Masteriyo > Course > Settings. Now, you can enable¬†Sell to Groups¬†and configure group pricing.

Now, click on¬†Update¬†to create a group.

Group settings

Navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Users > Groups¬†to manage various options for the group you create.

You can find all the groups you created on your website from here. From the settings tab, you can modify the following details:

  • Deactivate Enrollment on Status Change¬†- Enable this option to automatically deactivate the enrollment status of the members when the group status changes. The group status includes trashed, deleted, or drafted. This also reactivates the enrollment upon restoration.
  • Deactivate Enrollment on Member Change¬†- Enable this option to deactivate the enrollment status of the member who is removed from the group.
  • Group Buy Button Text¬†- From here, you can change the text of the button that appears at the checkout page for the group buy. Meanwhile, don't modify the placeholders like¬†{group_price}.
  • Group Buy Helper Test¬†- To let users know more about the group pricing, you can write any message regarding the group buy.

Click on¬†Save Settings¬†to experience the changes made in the group.

Group Pricing Workflow

At the frontend, students can buy the course for groups with similar behaviour as shown below:

The user can then view their payment receipt, yet can't access their course until the admin approves the group and publishes it.

Now, the admin should approve the group so that users can add other members. As an admin, navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Users > Groups. Here, you can see all the groups that are in draft. This means users have bought course for the groups, but you need to approve them manually. So, click on the draft group and you'll see the option to edit the order.

Next, change the status to completed after verifying the order and click on¬†Update Order.

User can be notified through email regarding their group enrollment, joining, and publishing. You can customize those emails through¬†Masteriyo > Settings > Emails.

At the user's dashboard, they can now refresh to add new members to their group. To add a new member, they can add the email of the person they want to add to the group.

You can also enable multiple currencies in Group Pricing. To do so, you need to enable the¬†Multiple Currency addon¬†and configure it.

You need to configure the addon by adding a pricing zone through¬†Masteriyo > Settings > Currencies.

After setting up the addon, navigate to the Course Builder of the course where you created the¬†Group. Now, toggle¬†Enable Multiple Currency.

Here, you‚Äôll see the zone you‚Äôve set up. You can enable whichever zone you want. Again, you have two options for the pricing method:

  • Enable price calculation by the exchange rate that you‚Äôve set up.
  • Set prices manually:¬†It allows you to set Regular, Sale, and Group prices for the course. - To set price manually, you need to add¬†Regular Price,¬†Sale Price, and the¬†Group Price.

Users can then pay the amount as per their choice of currency:
lessons.post_title: Setting up Group Enrollment

lessons.post_content:
With the Multiple Instructor feature, you can allow more than one instructor to take control of the course content.

Prerequisites:

  1. Masteriyo LMS Pro plan or higher.
  2. Active installation of Masteriyo LMS.
  3. Multiple Instructors Add-on enabled

Configuration

  1. Go to your¬†Dashboard¬†and navigate¬†Mastyeriyo->¬†Courses.
  2. Select¬†and¬†Edit¬†the course on which you want to add multiple instructors.
  3. Click on¬†Settings->General.
  4. Add instructor names in¬†Additional Instructors.
  5. Click on¬†Update.

You can sell online courses and accept credit card payments via Stripe. It also supports major cards like Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover, debit cards, etc.

How to Use?

Activate the¬†Stripe Payment Gateway Add-on

After activating the Stripe Payment Gateway add-on, login into your Stripe dashboard and copy the¬†Standard Keys,¬†Published Keys, and¬†Secret Keys; then, follow the below steps:

¬†

Note:¬†Want to know how to create and copy your API keys? Check this¬†documentation.

  1. Go to your¬†Dashboard, navigate->Masteriyo->¬†Settings
  2. Click on¬†Payments->Stripe->¬†Enable

After enabling the button, you'll need to set up the following options:

  1. Sandbox:¬†If you want to test your Stripe account, enable this button to test it. However, if your website is live and you've added your live key to your Stripe account, you don't need to enable it.
  2. Live Publishable Key:¬†Paste the Published key that you've copied earlier from your Stripe dashboard
  3. Live Secret Key:¬†Paste the Secret key that you've copied from your Stripe dashboard
  4. Webhook Secret Key:¬†Paste your Webhook Secret Key that you've copied
  5. Webhook Endpoint:¬†It notifies you when an event happens in your account
  6. Click on¬†Save Settings

Payment Showing incomplete?

¬†

For auto completion of the Stripe payment, you must link the webhook on your Stripe account.

  1. Please go to your¬†Dashboard->¬†Masteriyo->¬†Settings->¬†Payments->¬†Stripe-> At the bottom, you will find the¬†Webhook Endpoint->¬†Copy¬†the Webhook.
  2. Now login to your Stripe official account and go to the¬†Developers->¬†Webhook-> Click on¬†Add an Endpoint->¬†Paste¬†the Endpoint URL copied earlier.
  3. After pasting the webhook, you must select an¬†Event¬†before adding an Endpoint. Click on the select¬†Event¬†you will get multiple dropdown options-> Select the¬†Payment Intent->¬†Select all Payment Intents Events.
  4. Now you can add endpoints and save. The automatic payment completion will be work.

iDeal Support

Now, the Stripe payments for Masteriyo also supports iDeal payment. To enable this, go to:

Masteriyo > Settings > Payments > Stripe

Enable the iDeal Payments option and you are good to go. Now, the users will be able to pay via iDeal.

Make sure your Stripe account is activated.

¬†

The Stripe payment integration is available in the free version. However, if you want to use the subscription feature, you will need to upgrade to the Masteriyo Pro plan. To learn how to set up subscriptions using Stripe, please visit this link:¬†https://docs.masteriyo.com/faqs/how-to-create-course-with-recurring-payments.

Transform course completions into memorable achievements with Masteriyo's powerful Certificate Builder. This intuitive visual editor empowers you to design stunning, personalized certificates that students will be proud to share and display.

Prerequisites:

  1. Masteriyo LMS free plan or higher.
  2. Activate the Certificate Builder Add-on.
¬†

Note: Masteriyo LMS offers a single template in its¬†Free¬†plan, while all the templates and custom font options are available in the¬†Pro¬†plan or above.

Getting Started with Certificate Builder

To activate the addon, navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Addons¬†and search for¬†Certificate Builder. As soon as you see the addon, toggle it to enable it.

Now, follow these steps:

  1. Go to your¬†Dashboard¬†and navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Certificates.
  2. Click on¬†Add New Certificate.

  1. You'll now see templates for a certificate. Choose a¬†blank template¬†or one of the¬†starter templates¬†to build a certificate.

  • Blank Slate:¬†Create a certificate template from scratch using the Gutenberg editor.

  • Certificate Samples:¬†In the free version of the plugin, you only get a single sample, while you‚Äôll find multiple certificate samples in the premium versions; if you like any of them, you can use the one you want.

¬†

Note: If you dont see the templates, click on¬†Refresh Template¬†button.

Customize Your Certificate

After you select the sample or blank certificate, you can click on the full-screen icon to edit the certificate.

Gutenberg Blocks Available for Certificate Builder

You can enhance your certificate design by adding these dynamic Gutenberg blocks that automatically populate with student and course information.

For example:
Student Name:¬†The student's name is automatically generated on the certificate.
Course Title:¬†The course's title is automatically generated on the certificate.

To add the block, click on the¬†Block Inserter¬†and add your preferred blocks. Here are all the blocks available with Masteriyo LMS that you can use to customize your certificate:

  • Course Title: Dynamically displays the name of the completed course on the certificate.
  • Student Name: Automatically inserts the enrolled student's full name who earned the certificate.
  • QR Code: Generates a unique QR code containing certificate verification information for instant authenticity checks.
  • Course Completion Date¬†[Pro]: Shows the exact date when the student successfully finished the course.
  • Certificate Verification Code¬†[Pro]: Adds a unique alphanumeric code for manual certificate verification and fraud prevention.
  • Course Start Date¬†[Pro]: Displays when the student first began taking the course.
  • Course Grade Result¬†[Pro]: Shows the student's final grade or score (requires Gradebook Addon activation).
  • Instructor Name¬†[Pro]: Includes the primary course instructor's name on the certificate.
  • Co-Instructors Names¬†[Pro]: Lists all additional instructors for the course (requires Multiple Instructors addon).
  • Course Duration¬†[Pro]: Calculates and displays the total time the student spent completing the course.
  • Current Date¬†[Pro]: Inserts today's date when the certificate is generated or downloaded.
  • Current Time¬†[Pro]: Adds the current time when the certificate is created.
  • Current Timestamp¬†[Pro]: Provides a complete date and time stamp for precise certificate generation tracking.

QR Verification for Certificates¬†

Pro

You can create a QR verification for the certificates you have created. For this, follow the steps below:

  • Click on the block inserter icon'+'.
  • Search for QR Code and drag and drop the block.

Once the course is completed, users can download their certificate containing the QR code.

Certificate Settings

You can also configure further settings through¬†Certificates > Settings:

  • Use Image Absolute Path: Controls how images in certificates are referenced. When enabled, it uses full URL paths for images instead of relative paths
  • Use SSL Verify Host: Security setting for certificate generation, when enabled, it verifies SSL certificates when connecting to external hosts

Install Custom Fonts¬†

Pro

By default, Masteriyo will have multiple fonts that you can use to customize the certificate. From here, you can install the other fonts. To change the fonts, on the certificate builder, click the block and then the¬†Settings. Now, scroll down to find¬†Typography > Font. From the dropdown, you can choose any fonts you wish.

Install Custom Fonts

It lets you upload and use custom fonts that are unavailable with the plugin. Click the Upload button to upload the zip file of custom fonts.

Click on¬†Save Settings¬†and return to the certificate builder.

You can see the custom fonts you just uploaded under¬†Typography > Fonts. Select to use on your certificate.

After adding the necessary blocks, fonts, and information to your certificate, you can preview the certificate through the¬†Preview¬†button in the top-right corner:

Add Certificate to Course

Once you create the¬†Certificate template, you must assign that template to your specific courses. Follow the instructions below to assign Certificates to courses.

  1. Go to your¬†Dashboard¬†and navigate to¬†Masteriyo > Courses.
  2. Select¬†and¬†Edit¬†the course on which you want to add a Certificate.
  3. Navigate¬†Settings > Certificate.
  4. Click on the toggle button to activate the Certificate.

  1. Select the Certificate for the Course.

Send Certificate via email after Course Completion¬†

Pro

Enabling this option will send the certificate directly to the user's email after completing the course.

Allow to Share the Certificate of Your Course

To let users share certificates of the course, you can enable the Share Certificate option.

Now,¬†Update¬†the course to save your changes.

Sample of Student Experience with Certificate

After completing the course, student can easily download the certificate from their account. The download link will appear just after they complete their course.

After clicking on the download link, the certificate will be saved on their device:

¬†In this lesson, you‚Äôll learn how Masteriyo‚Äôs intuitive hierarchy of Courses ‚Üí Sections ‚Üí Lessons is designed to deliver a seamless, engaging learning experience that puts your end users first. We‚Äôll break down each layer of the structure, explain its unique features and expected outcomes, and show you how our no-reload, instant‚Äëtransition approach creates an experience no other LMS can match.

1. Course

A Course is the top‚Äëlevel container that groups together all of your content around a single topic or learning goal. It provides:

  • Big-picture context for learners, helping them understand the path from start to finish

  • Global settings (access rules, drip schedules, certificates) that apply everywhere beneath it

  • A single entry point for navigation, enrolling, and tracking progress

Expected outcome: Learners immediately see the full scope of what they‚Äôll achieve, and instructors manage enrollment and settings in one place.

2. Sections

Within each Course, Sections act as logical chapters or modules. Each Section:

  • Groups related Lessons so your learners can focus on one sub‚Äëtopic at a time

  • Supports mixed media videos, slides, text, quizzes, and more, all in one place

  • Renders instantly without page‚Äëreloads, thanks to Masteriyo‚Äôs AJAX‚Äëpowered interface

Expected outcome: Learners breeze from one Section to the next with zero waiting, staying fully immersed in the material.

3. Lessons

A Lesson is the atomic unit of learning. Masteriyo supports multiple Lesson types, each tailored to different pedagogical needs:

  • Video lessons for visual walkthroughs and demonstrations

  • Text & image lessons for in‚Äëdepth explanations and diagrams

  • Interactive quizzes to test comprehension in real time

  • Assignments & downloads to reinforce and apply new skills

¬†

4. Why Masteriyo‚Äôs Structure Is Unique

Unlike traditional LMS platforms that force full‚Äëpage reloads or rigid course maps, Masteriyo‚Äôs architecture:

  • Eliminates load times between every click, keeping learners focused

  • Delivers smooth transitions so Sections and Lessons feel like part of one fluid experience

  • Customizes for your audience, letting you emphasize the best content format for each topic

Because we built Courses ‚Üí Sections ‚Üí Lessons from the ground up with the end user in mind, you get:

  • Higher engagement (no friction or wait times)

  • Easier navigation (always know where you are and what‚Äôs next)

  • Greater flexibility (mix content types without technical constraints)

¬†
lessons.post_title: Course, Sections, Lessons, What Goes Where & Why

lessons.post_content:
Masteriyo is a freemium WordPress LMS (Learning Management System) plugin that enables users to build, manage, and sell online courses directly on their WordPress site. It‚Äôs designed for a wide range of users, from individual instructors, coaches, and content creators to institutions and corporate teams, offering tools for course creation, quizzes, assignments, certificates, and ecommerce integration.

What is Masteriyo?

  • A WordPress plugin focusing on an all‚Äëin‚Äëone solution to create and sell courses online.

  • Built with React JS and uses a single-page application UI, ensuring a smooth and modern backend/ frontend experience.

  • Supports features like drag‚Äëand‚Äëdrop course builder, quizzes, progress tracking, payment gateways (PayPal, Stripe, WooCommerce), content dripping, certificates, analytics, bulk user/course import/export, and more.

¬†Key Benefits of Using Masteriyo

  1. Fast & Easy Setup
    With a setup wizard, you can get your LMS up and running in under a minute‚Äîno coding required.

  2. User-friendly Course Creation
    Leveraging an intuitive drag‚Äëand‚Äëdrop builder, React-powered interface, distraction-free learning pages, and unlimited courses/lessons/quizzes.

  3. Built-in Sales and Monetization Tools
    Includes payment systems via Stripe, PayPal, WooCommerce, coupon management, order systems, revenue sharing, and subscription support‚Äîwithout the need for third-party plugins.

  4. Comprehensive Management & Analytics
    Features like gradebook, student progress tracking, reporting dashboards, bulk user enrollment/import/export, and CSV support.

  5. Scalable and Flexible
    Unlimited instructors, students, courses, compatibility with WordPress themes and page builders (Elementor, Divi, Bricks, etc.), plus add-ons like Zoom/Google Meet, SCORM, live streaming, QR login, ‚Äúcoming soon‚Äù timers, etc..

  6. Freemium Model
    A robust free tier covers core LMS essentials, making it easy to start. As needs grow, optional premium plans add advanced features like multi-instructor support, certificates, and downloads.

  7. Strong Support & Security
    Frequent updates, clean code, compatibility with WordPress security standards, plus documentation, live support and an active community.

How was Masteriyo Born?

Summary

Masteriyo artfully brings together a modern React-based interface, powerful LMS features, built-in commerce, and simple setup, all within WordPress. You can start for free, grow with paid addons, and maintain full control over your courses. It's an efficient, scalable, and cost-effective LMS tool designed to serve both beginners and pros.

Turn plain text into powerful learning moments by leveraging Masteriyo‚Äôs rich editor, media support, and smart linking. In this lesson, you‚Äôll learn how to write lessons that inform, inspire, and guide your students toward real results.

1. Structure Your Story

  • Start with a Clear Objective
    Open each lesson with a one‚Äësentence promise: ‚ÄúBy the end of this lesson, you‚Äôll understand‚Ä¶‚Äù

  • Break It into Bite‚ÄëSized Steps
    Use headings and numbered lists to guide readers through complex ideas one step at a time.

Why it works: A logical flow keeps learners from feeling overwhelmed and highlights progress.

2. Use Formatting That Guides the Eye

  • Headings & Subheadings
    Divide content into scannable chunks so students can jump to the part they need.

  • Bold & Italics
    Emphasize key terms or concepts‚Äîbut use sparingly to maintain impact.

  • Blockquotes & Callouts
    Highlight quotes, tips, or side‚Äënotes to draw attention to important insights.

Why it works: Strategic formatting transforms walls of text into engaging, digestible content.

3. Embed Media for Rich Context

  • Images & Diagrams
    Drop in charts, infographics, or step‚Äëby‚Äëstep visuals to illustrate abstract ideas.

  • Videos & Audio Clips
    Embed short clips to demonstrate techniques or walk through examples in action.

  • Downloads & Attachments
    Link to worksheets, templates, or cheat‚Äësheets so learners can apply concepts immediately.

Why it works: Multimedia caters to different learning styles and reinforces retention.

4. Link Wisely to Add Depth

  • Internal Course Links
    Connect to related Lessons or Sections help students explore background material without leaving the course.

  • External Resources
    Point to authoritative articles, case studies, or tools for deeper dives.

  • Anchor Text
    Use descriptive link text (‚ÄúDownload the SEO Checklist‚Äù) instead of generic ‚ÄúClick here.‚Äù

Why it works: Thoughtful links enrich learning without distracting from your core narrative.

5. Action‚ÄëOriented Summaries & Next Steps

  • Recap Key Takeaways
    End each lesson with 2‚Äì3 bullet points summarizing what was learned.

  • Clear Calls‚Äëto‚ÄëAction
    Invite students to complete an exercise, post a comment, or move on to the next Lesson.

Why it works: A concise summary cements understanding, while clear actions keep learners moving forward.

Harness Masteriyo‚Äôs rich text editor and media‚Äësupport features to write lessons that aren‚Äôt just read, but experienced.
By structuring your content thoughtfully, embedding the right media, and guiding learners with smart links and calls‚Äëto‚Äëaction, you‚Äôll create text lessons that drive outcomes, and keep students coming back for more.

Lesson: Set Difficulty, Access, Visibility, ‚ÄØYour Course, Your Rules

Take full control of who sees your content, when they see it, and how challenging it is. With Masteriyo‚Äôs flexible course‚Äëlevel settings, you tailor the perfect learning experience for every audience.

1. Dial In the Difficulty

  • Simple Sliders for Skill Levels
    Tag each course as ‚ÄúBeginner,‚Äù ‚ÄúIntermediate,‚Äù or ‚ÄúAdvanced‚Äù in one click, no guesswork required.

  • Clear Expectations for Learners
    Display your chosen difficulty right on the course card so students know they‚Äôre signing up for the right challenge.

Why it matters: Matching content to skill level reduces frustration, boosts completion rates, and keeps learners motivated.

2. Control Access with Ease

  • Open vs. Need registration vs. Paid
    Choose exactly who can enroll:

    • Open: Let anyone join for free or purchase.

    • Need registration: registrered user can access.

    • Paid: Gate content behind one‚Äëtime payments or subscriptions.

  • Drip & Schedule
    Release lessons on a schedule, daily, weekly, or custom, so students progress at your ideal pace.

Why it matters: Strategic access rules drive revenue, foster commitment, and protect your premium content.

3. Visibility That Works for You

  • Draft, Publish, Private
    Keep your work‚Äëin‚Äëprogress hidden until it‚Äôs perfect, then go live instantly.

  • Password Protection & Enrollment Keys
    Secure your course with passwords or unique access codes for special promotions, partners, or VIP students.

  • Feature & Spotlight
    Toggle ‚ÄúFeatured‚Äù to put your highest‚Äëimpact course front and center in your catalog.

Why it matters: Complete visibility control means you launch on your terms, manage promotions seamlessly, and reach precisely the audience you want.

4. Why Masteriyo‚Äôs Rules Rule

  • No Plugins Needed: All these settings live natively in one intuitive interface.

  • Instant Updates: Change difficulty, access, or visibility and see it apply immediately, no page reloads, no downtime.

  • Data‚ÄëDriven Insights: Combine with analytics to see which difficulty tiers and access models perform best.

Expected outcome: You‚Äôll craft targeted, exclusive, and perfectly paced courses that attract the right students, maximize engagement, and grow your revenue.

Own every aspect of your course experience.
With Masteriyo, it‚Äôs not just what you teach that matters, it‚Äôs how, when, and to whom you teach it. Set your rules, unlock your potential, and watch your community thrive.

Masteriyo gives you absolute control over when and how your course goes live. Whether you need a private drafting space, an instant launch, or a high‚Äëhype soft release, it‚Äôs all just a click away.

1. Draft Mode: Perfect Your Course in Private

  • Hidden from Catalogs & Search: Save as Draft to keep your work‚Äëin‚Äëprogress invisible to students.

  • Safe Experimentation: Rename lessons, swap videos, or reorganize sections without any risk, your learners won‚Äôt see changes until you‚Äôre ready.

2. Publish Instantly: Go Live at Your Command

  • One‚ÄëClick Launch: Hit ‚ÄúPublish‚Äù and your course immediately appears in your catalog, open for enrollment.

  • Real‚ÄëTime Updates: Any edits you make post‚Äëlaunch are saved and reflected instantly, no technical headaches or page reloads.

3. Soft‚ÄëLaunch with Course Coming Soon: Build Anticipation

  • Coming Soon Badge & Teaser: Enable the add‚Äëon, and your upcoming course automatically carries a ‚ÄúComing Soon‚Äù badge on both single and archive pages.

  • Set Your Release Date: Pick any future date to unlock full enrollment, and until then, students can preview the page but can‚Äôt purchase or enroll.

  • Live Countdown Timer: A dynamic timer counts down to launch day, followed by a custom welcome message once your course goes live.

  • Customize the Preview: Control exactly what learners see, hide meta‚Äëdata, tweak your teaser copy, or showcase a sneak‚Äëpeek video to stoke excitement.

Why Masteriyo‚Äôs Launch Control Wins

  • Flexibility: Seamlessly switch between Draft, Publish, or Soft‚ÄëLaunch without plugin juggling.

  • Hype & Feedback: A soft launch lets you gather early interest, feedback, and testimonials before full release.

  • Effortless Management: All settings live in one intuitive interface no code, no delay, no drama.

Take the reins of your course‚Äôs lifecycle. With Masteriyo‚Äôs easy mode toggles and built‚Äëin ‚ÄúComing Soon‚Äù add‚Äëon, you decide exactly who sees what and when. Ready to master your launch?

Give your course the ultimate quality pass by stepping into your students‚Äô shoes, no extra signup needed. Masteriyo‚Äôs Preview feature lets you experience your full course exactly as learners will, so you catch every hiccup before you go live.

1. Instant Student View

  • One‚ÄëClick Preview
    From any Course or Lesson screen, hit ‚ÄúPreview as Student‚Äù and jump straight into the learner interface.

  • No Enrollment Required
    Skip the signup process, see your content, navigation, quizzes, and attachments just as a student would.

Benefit: You save time and avoid confusing back‚Äëand‚Äëforth between accounts.

2. Validate Every Detail

  • Check Media Playback
    Watch videos, open downloads, and test embedded files to ensure everything loads correctly.

  • Test Quizzes & Assignments
    Run through questions and submission flows to confirm instant feedback and grading work as intended.

  • Review Progress Tracking
    Follow your own progress bar and completion badges to make sure milestones unlock at the right moments.

Benefit: Eliminate broken links, formatting issues, and gating errors before your learners ever see them.

3. Experience the Flow

  • Smooth Navigation
    Click between Sections and Lessons with zero load times, just like your students will.

  • Mobile & Desktop Checks
    Resize your browser or switch to mobile preview to guarantee a seamless experience on any device.

Benefit: Deliver a polished, frustration‚Äëfree journey, whether your students are on a phone, tablet, or laptop.

4. Catch & Fix on the Spot

  • Live Editing Link
    While in Preview, jump straight into the editor to tweak any title, description, or media.

  • Auto‚ÄëSave Sync
    Changes you make carry over immediately, no need to exit preview mode or reload the page.

Benefit: Instant fixes mean you maintain creative momentum and never lose track of what needs adjustment.

5. Launch with Confidence

  • Final Quality Gate
    With a 360¬∞ student view, you‚Äôll know exactly how every element appears and functions.

  • Zero Surprises
    Avoid post‚Äëlaunch support tickets by resolving all issues in advance.

Result: A flawless first impression, happy learners from day one, and more time focusing on growing your course.

Preview, polish, and perfect, without ever enrolling.
With Masteriyo‚Äôs built‚Äëin student preview, your final check is as simple as a click. Ready to see your course through fresh eyes? Take the student‚Äôs seat before you launch!

Your course should feel like a story. Here‚Äôs how to structure it for flow and engagement.

1. Hook Your Learners from the Very First Click

  • Set the Scene: Start with a compelling Course Overview, eye‚Äëcatching hero image, a brief video teaser, and three bullet‚Äëpoint highlights of what‚Äôs to come.

  • Promise the Adventure: Clearly state the transformation learners will experience (‚ÄúBy lesson five, you‚Äôll be designing your own custom templates!‚Äù).

Why it works: A strong opening scene makes learners lean in, eager for the next chapter.

2. Act I ‚Äì The Setup: Introduce the Characters

  • Create a Clear Roadmap: Use your first Section to lay out the course map, what they‚Äôll learn and why it matters.

  • Build Connection: Share your ‚Äúwhy‚Äù story or a quick case study so learners see themselves in the tale.

Why it works: Introducing context and stakes draws learners into your narrative world.

3. Act II ‚Äì Rising Action: Develop Your Plot in Sections

  • Chunk by Chapter: Turn each Section into a new ‚Äúchapter‚Äù with its own mini‚Äëgoal (e.g., ‚ÄúMaster the Basics,‚Äù ‚ÄúLevel Up Your Skills‚Äù).

  • Plot Twists & Teasers: End each Section with a cliffhanger, like a quiz question or a quick win preview, to spark curiosity about what‚Äôs next.

Why it works: A sense of progression and surprise keeps engagement high and drop‚Äëoff low.

4. Act III ‚Äì The Climax: Your Signature Lessons

  • Showcase Your Greatest Hits: Position your most impactful video demos, in‚Äëdepth tutorials, or challenges at the course‚Äôs midpoint.

  • Interactive Turning Point: Use a hands‚Äëon assignment or group discussion to deepen learning and create a memorable ‚Äúaha‚Äù moment.

Why it works: A powerful centerpiece lesson cements key concepts and gives learners confidence to push forward.

5. Act IV ‚Äì Resolution: Tie It All Together

  • Summarize the Journey: In your final Section, recap the core lessons, celebrate milestones, and share next‚Äëstep recommendations.

  • Award & Advance: Deliver a certificate of completion or badge, then point learners toward advanced courses or community forums.

Why it works: A satisfying ending reinforces achievement and encourages ongoing engagement.

6. Seamless Flow with Masteriyo‚Äôs Instant Transitions

  • Zero Load Times: Move from one lesson to the next without a single page reload‚Äîlearners stay immersed in your story, not waiting for the page.

  • Visual Progress Bar: Keep the narrative momentum visible so students always know ‚Äúhow far they‚Äôve come‚Äù and ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next.‚Äù

Why it works: Smooth, React‚Äëpowered navigation feels like turning pages in a novel, not clicking through slides.

7. Bonus Tips for Maximum Engagement

  • Sprinkle in Multimedia: Embed short video clips, GIFs, and audio quotes to add color and maintain pace.

  • Cliffhangers & Call‚Äëto‚ÄëAction: End key lessons with a teaser (‚ÄúNext up: the secret shortcut!‚Äù) and a simple ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù button that beckons that masteriyo provides guides to it.

  • Personal Touches: Use the description area to tell little anecdotes or share extra resources, learners love the feeling of a personal guide.

Turn your course into an unforgettable journey, not just a checklist.
With Masteriyo‚Äôs storytelling framework and lightning‚Äëfast interface, you‚Äôll craft an experience so smooth and compelling that your students won‚Äôt just learn, they‚Äôll embark on an adventure. Ready to write your next chapter? Start structuring your course like a story today!

With Masteriyo‚Äôs lightning‚Äëfast interface, you can spin up a full course structure before you‚Äôve even finished your morning coffee, no technical background required. Here‚Äôs how it works:

Why It Feels Magical

Turn your quizzes into powerful learning milestones, rather than mere checkpoints, by leveraging customizable pass marks, targeted feedback, and controlled retakes. Masteriyo‚Äôs Smart Assessment tools give you the precision to motivate learners and the flexibility to reinforce mastery.

1. Define Your Pass Criteria

  • Flexible Pass Points: Specify the minimum score required to pass in points or percentages, perfect for courses that range from quick quizzes to in‚Äëdepth exams.¬†¬†

  • Auto‚ÄëCalculate Scoring: Let Masteriyo distribute point values evenly across questions, or manually assign weights for greater control.¬†¬†

2. Deliver Instant, Insightful Feedback

  • Per‚ÄëQuestion Explanations: Add answer explanations that display immediately after submission, so learners understand why an answer is correct or where they went wrong.¬†¬†

  • Custom Pass/Fail Messages: Craft global feedback that appears only on success or only on failure, include next‚Äëstep resources, encouragement, or links to remedial lessons.

3. Control Retakes & Reveal Modes

  • Attempts Allowed: Choose unlimited attempts for low‚Äëstakes practice or set a strict limit to simulate real‚Äëworld exams.¬†

  • Reveal Mode: Enable a one‚Äëattempt ‚Äúlocked‚Äù quiz that shows correct answers only after submission ideal for mastery checks or certification tests.¬†

4. Integrate with Gradebook & Weighted Scoring

  • Weighted Assessments: Assign relative importance to each quiz or assignment so that critical evaluations carry more weight toward the final grade.¬†

  • Custom Grade Scales: Build bespoke grading ranges (A+, Excellent, 0‚Äì30%, etc.) to match your institution‚Äôs standards or your personal grading rubric.¬†

  • Centralized Results Dashboard: View all quiz and assignment outcomes in one place, filter, export, and track performance trends effortlessly.¬†¬†

5. Leverage Global Quiz Settings

  • Guest Access Rules: Offer read‚Äëonly previews to visitors or lock quizzes completely behind enrolment, choose per-quiz access with a simple toggle.¬†¬†

  • Learner Feedback Collection: Enable students to leave quiz reviews, giving you actionable insights on question quality and user experience.¬†¬†

By setting clear pass thresholds, delivering contextual feedback, and managing retakes with precision, Masteriyo turns assessment from a bureaucratic hurdle into a dynamic learning tool. Ready to build smarter quizzes that drive real results? Dive in and start crafting your Smart Assessment workflows today!

Location:
‚ÄØ‚ÄØMasteriyo ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Advanced ‚Üí Tracking ‚Üí Track Student Activity

Purpose:
‚ÄØ‚ÄØMonitor and report on learner engagement by capturing:

Key Settings

  1. Server Sync Interval Duration (minutes)
    ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚Ä¢ How often the plugin pushes updated activity data to your server
    ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚Ä¢ Default:‚ÄØ5‚ÄØminutes (near real‚Äëtime reporting, minimizes data loss)

  2. Idle Time Threshold (minutes)
    ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚Ä¢ How long of no‚Äëactivity before a session is marked ‚Äúidle‚Äù
    ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚Ä¢ Default:‚ÄØ30‚ÄØminutes (distinguishes truly active learners from idle sessions)

How It Works

  • Every Server Sync Interval the system batches and sends students‚Äô click‚Äëstream data.

  • If a student is inactive past the Idle Time Threshold, their session is flagged idle, keeping your ‚Äútime spent‚Äù stats accurate.

Accessing Reports

  1. Go to Dashboard ‚Üí Masteriyo ‚Üí Courses

  2. Click the ‚ãÆ menu beside any course

  3. Select Reports

  4. View per‚Äëstudent activity, progress, and ‚ÄúTime Spent‚Äù (which reflects your sync‚Äëinterval setting)

Tip: Adjust the sync interval and idle threshold to balance reporting precision with server load.

Lesson: How to Sequence Your Lessons for Maximum Retention

Your learners‚Äô brains are like sponges, but only when you pour knowledge in the right order. In this lesson, you‚Äôll discover how to arrange your content so students absorb more, forget less, and feel confident every step of the way.

1. Honor Cognitive Load: Start Light, Then Layer

  • Introduce Core Concepts First
    Begin with the simplest ideas definitions, key terms, and big‚Äëpicture context, so learners build a solid mental framework.

  • Avoid Overwhelm
    Limit each lesson to 1‚Äì2 new concepts. If you try to teach too much at once, retention plummets.

Result: Students grasp foundational ideas quickly and come to each new lesson ready for more.

2. Chunk & Scaffold: Break It Into Bite‚ÄëSized Steps

  • Group Related Skills
    Bundle comparable tasks (e.g., ‚ÄúFormatting Basics‚Äù vs. ‚ÄúAdvanced Styling‚Äù) into separate lessons.

  • Scaffold Complexity
    Within Sections, order lessons so each one builds on the last think ‚Äústep 1 ‚Üí step 2 ‚Üí step 3,‚Äù not ‚Äújump straight to step 5.‚Äù

Result: A logical progression keeps learners motivated by giving them early wins before tackling harder material.

3. Space & Interleave: Mix It Up for Deeper Learning

  • Spacing
    Don‚Äôt clump all quizzes or exercises at the end. Instead, sprinkle small review questions throughout the course so knowledge ‚Äústicks.‚Äù

  • Interleaving
    Alternate between related but distinct topics (for example, ‚ÄúImage Placement‚Äù followed by ‚ÄúText Styling‚Äù) so students learn to tell concepts apart.

Result: Spaced and interleaved practice boosts long‚Äëterm retention and helps learners apply skills flexibly.

4. Retrieval Practice: Make Students Recall, Don‚Äôt Just Review

  • Low‚ÄëStakes Quizzes
    Pop in quick 1‚Äë or 2‚Äëquestion checks at the start of each lesson to reinforce yesterday‚Äôs material.

  • Reflection Prompts
    End lessons with a short open‚Äëended question (‚ÄúHow would you apply this tip in your own project?‚Äù).

Result: Actively recalling information strengthens memory far more than passive reading or watching.

5. Layer in Multimedia for Multimodal Reinforcement

  • Visual Aids
    Show diagrams or annotated screenshots right after introducing a new concept.

  • Short Video Demonstrations
    Follow up text lessons with a 2‚Äëminute clip that visually walks through the steps.

Result: Engaging multiple senses helps learners build richer mental models and accelerates mastery.

6. Leverage Masteriyo‚Äôs Flow‚ÄëFirst Interface

  • Smooth Transitions
    With zero load‚Äëtimes between lessons, students stay in ‚Äúlearning mode‚Äù without distraction.

  • Drag‚Äëand‚ÄëDrop Sequencing
    Easily rearrange your lessons on the fly experiment with different orders until the flow feels perfect.

  • Preview as a Student
    Walk through the full sequence yourself before launch to catch any jarring jumps or overloads.

Result: You iterate faster, refine your sequence, and deliver a flawless, high‚Äëengagement learning journey.

By following these principles managing cognitive load, chunking content, spacing practice, and using Masteriyo‚Äôs instant interface you‚Äôll transform a simple list of topics into a carefully choreographed learning adventure. Your students won‚Äôt just complete your course; they‚Äôll remember and apply what they‚Äôve learned for months (or years) to come.
